project.teaser: The global biodiversity and climate crises cannot be solved in isolation or by merely ramping up what is already being done. Urgent and ambitious transformative changes are needed in our economies and societies. Through inclusive deliberation TRANSPATH identifies leverage...
project.objective: The global biodiversity and climate crises cannot be solved in isolation or by merely ramping up what is already being done. Urgent and ambitious transformative changes are needed in our economies and societies. Through inclusive deliberation TRANSPATH identifies leverage points and interventions for triggering transformative changes at consumer, producer and organisational levels. It seeks whole-of-society opportunities for achieving climate-neutrality whilst simultaneously allowing local communities and nature to flourish. TRANSPATH draws on diverse contexts in Eastern and Western Europe, Africa and Latin America, to engage with those who affect and are affected by trade regimes and associated ‘greening’ mechanisms. Through deliberation on alternative visions, values, actions, and their systemic interactions across scales and over time, TRANSPATH identifies leverage points that can trigger positive cascading biodiversity changes. Policy packages and other interventions are designed, to enable the emergence of leverage points at different scales of action in ways that changes the choice architecture underlying daily decisions. These interventions consider the synergies and trade-offs of actions across multiple people and places, and the role of incentives and political barriers to implementation. TRANSPATH delivers a suite of Transformative Pathways with a Toolbox of Transformative Interventions for triggering and enabling these pathways. A Transformative Navigation Toolkit guides practitioners on how to enable and navigate pathways, acknowledging that arriving at what constitutes a ‘transformative pathway' is also a product of an iterative and adaptive process that emerges and evolves over time. To implement these, TRANSPATH develops a multi-scalar network of activated agents of change, who can foster inclusive and legitimate decisions, and build capacity and willingness among their actor networks to collectively move forward on transformative pathways.
project.title: Transformative pathways for synergising just biodiversity and climate actions
project.keywords: Biodiversity, climate, transformative change, leverage points, levers, tipping interventions, social innovation, nature-based solutions, dialogue, planetary boundaries, justice, integrated assessment

article.title: Enabling pathways to positive biodiversity changes

result.title: Positive Tipping points towards global regenerative systems
Review of policy interventions and entry points in trade regulations, financial sector and international commodity value chains
result.description: Review of policy interventions and policy entry points in the general context of trade regulations, the financial sector and international commodity value chains. Including exploration of the leverage points and potential interventions identified in WP1, 2 and 3. It will test policies that change the incentives at multiple nodes of international value chains. Report and information for dissemination in WP5 (M12, resulting from Task 4.1)

result.title: Policy Workshop 1 Report
result.description: Report from the Policy workshops which document the key discussions and decision made with the Policy Board of high level policy officials (~2 weeks following the workshop date, i.e. ~M12, resulting from Task 5.3)

result.title: Transformative Navigation Toolkit (Version 1)
result.description: Draft version of Transformative Navigation Toolkit: Knowledge and normative methodological guidance to reflexively guide and assess TRANSPATH WPs and align to transformative ontological, epistemological and normative principles (e.g. according to a just and safe operating space) [Draft Report (M6), resulting from Task 1.2]

result.title: ESD Ideas: Positive tipping points towards global regenerative systems
Roadmap for Science-policy-practitioner Labs
result.description: Roadmap for Science-policy-practitioner Lab processes to guide the process of co-designing transformative pathways, building on frontier knowledge on co-creation methods (Report M12, resulting from Task 2.1)

result.title: Joint activities with other projects/initiatives on transformative change and related topics
result.description: Report on links and activities with other initiatives projects/initiatives on transformative change and related topics. This will include detailed communication channels, KPIs, and planned exchanges of collaboration and joint dissemination efforts and events (M12, D22, resulting from Task 5.2)

result.title: Project branding and website
result.description: Project brand and website, including a recognisable project logo and overall graphic identity, a Brand Manual, a brochure, poster, rollup banner, and deliverable, milestone & presentation templates (M6, D21, resulting from Task 5.2)

result.title: Conceptual Framework
result.description: Conceptual framework synthesising and reviewing current knowledge on how to trigger, enable and navigate transformative pathways that synergise biodiversity and climate action and are respectful to social-cultural contexts and rights, given unpredictable futures over long timeframes. [Report and information from Task 1.1 for dissemination to broad audience in WP5 (M12)]

result.title: Transformative Navigation Toolkit (Version 2)
result.description: Version 2 of Transformative Navigation Toolkit: Knowledge and normative methodological guidance to reflexively guide and assess TRANSPATH WPs and align to transformative ontological, epistemological and normative principles (e.g. according to a just and safe operating space) [version 2 (M18), resulting from Task 1.2]

result.title: Coordination plan
result.description: Coordination plan for coordinating team collaboration, information flows, quality, risk and guidelines to ensure that all costs incurred are in line with Horizon Europe rules and provisions (M1, Task 6.1)

result.title: Plan for Exploitation and Dissemination of Results (PEDR) and Communication Plan (CP) (version 1)
result.description: Version 1: Plan for Exploitation and Dissemination of Results (PEDR) and Communication Plan (CP), including appropriate monitoring tools will be established with Key Performance Indicators for each action (M6, resulting from Task 5.1)

result.title: Regenerative sustainability. A relational model of possibilities for the emergence of positive tipping points
Periodic Reporting for period 1 - TRANSPATH (Transformative pathways for synergising just biodiversity and climate actions)
result.teaser: Our planet is under mounting pressure. Under our current lifestyle, three planets would be needed to sustain present consumption. Unsustainable consumption and production are drivers of three planetary crises: climate change, biodiversity loss, and pollution. While measures...

result.title: Data Management Plan 1
result.description: Data Management Plan 1 in accordance to the Horizon Europe Data Management Plan template and to comply with FAIR data principles in alignment to General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR; 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016) and applicable laws and regulations (M6, Task 6.2)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
